We know that the majority of our viewers will be watching the tournament unfold over the internet, so we'd like to make it easier for an online fan to dig deeper into the event, the teams, and the players. In addition to wanting more detail, we know fans also love to compete with each other at predicting tournament results. This year we're taking our first shot at addressing all of the these concepts, with an additional step that we hope will result in the tournament itself getting bigger and better as a direct result of fan enthusiasm.

Today we're announcing [i]The International[/i] [url=http://www.dota2.com/tournaments/international/compendium/]Interactive Compendium[/url], a virtual book that will keep you fully up to date with the state of [i]The International[/i], and allow you to play games with other fans for fun and bragging rights. In addition to making you eligible for special virtual item drops throughout the tournament, it'll also allow you to vote on tournament-related community polls, such as the selection of which player should receive awards based on their play in the tournament. After the tournament is over, you'll be able to browse your friends' Compendiums to see how successful they were in their predictions.

Finally, to directly tie fan interest in Compendiums to the players themselves, we're going to redirect 25% of the revenue directly into the prize pool. That means the total $1.6 million prize pool for The International is now just the starting point. The Compendium will be available in the [url=http://www.dota2.com/store/]Dota Store[/url] tomorrow morning at 10:00am PDT. For those of you planning to attend The International in person, your ticket purchase will include a Compendium.

announcement_body.headline: The Worldsmith Wakes
announcement_body.body:
The Elder Titan returns to the world he shattered!

[url=http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/images/blogfiles/keyart_eldr_ttn.jpg][img]http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/images/blogfiles/inline_eldr_ttn.jpg[/img][/url]

The International tickets will go on sale on Tuesday, May 7th, at 10:00am PDT. They will be sold directly through the [url=http://www.dota2.com/store/]Dota 2 Store[/url]. This year we'll be putting all tickets up for sale at once, so set your alarm clocks.

We've also updated the [url=http://www.dota2.com/tournaments/international/announcement/]The International Qualifiers[/url] with the 16 competing teams. Divided into East and West, these teams will compete for the 3 remaining slots in The International. The West Qualifier will be hosted by [url=http://www.twitch.tv/thegdstudio]GDStudio[/url] from May 13th through the 19th, and the East Qualifier by [url=http://www.twitch.tv/beyondthesummit]BeyondTheSummit[/url] from May 20th through the 26th. All qualifier matches will also be available for free through DotaTV, right inside your Dota client.

Updates notes go [url=http://www.dota2.com/news/updates/]here[/url].

announcement_body.headline: Your New Wingman
announcement_body.body:
Introducing Skywrath Mage!

[url=http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/images/blogfiles/keyart_skywramg001.jpg][img]http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/images/blogfiles/inline_skywramg001.jpg[/img][/url]

 

Today we’ve shipped some changes to the report system as part of our ongoing initiatives in the community space. We’d like to do what we can to discourage some of the negativity that can go on during games as well as encourage folks to exhibit more cooperative behavior with other members of the community.

To that end, we’ve implemented the following changes:

-- We’re restricting the number of report fields per report to a single field in the hopes of increasing some of the clarity for the specific behavior being reported.

-- In concert with the above change, we’ve combined the ‘text’ and ‘voice’ abuse fields in the report dialog into a single ‘communication’ field.

-- We’re implementing a stricter system of communication (both text and voice) bans for abusive players. The system takes into account reports, in-game behavior, and other factors to determine whether or not a ban is warranted. These bans will be for voice and text communication channels only; they will not affect matchmaking, and they will not place players in the low-priority pool. The bans escalate according to the following scale:
[list]
	[*]1st ban: 1 day[/*]
	[*]2nd ban: 2 days[/*]
	[*]3rd (and subsequent) bans: 1 week[/*]
[/list]
-- We’re changing the number of report submissions per week to 4 to act as an initial baseline, as we fine-tune the system.

-- We've removed a couple of lesser-used features (like spectators being able to report) that our data has shown not to correlate with accurate reports of bad behavior.

These changes are the beginning of a series of ongoing efforts to make the gameplay experience for all members of the DOTA community as enjoyable as possible. We’re going to be constantly monitoring and improving the system (and running many more experiments) as we go along, and we’re hopeful you’ll find these changes result in an improved experience in-game.

Patch notes are available [url=http://www.dota2.com/news/updates/]here[/url].

announcement_body.headline: Back In Action!
announcement_body.body:
Better watch your back, because Bristleback is back! [u](kill me)[/u].

[url=http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/images/blogfiles/keyart_bristleback.jpg][img]http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/images/blogfiles/inline_bristleback.jpg[/img][/url]

Something we're very excited about this week is Anuxi's [url=http://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=133304836]Treasure of the Shaper Divine Chest[/url]. Look at all that stuff! This marks the first Chest entirely composed of items created by a single Workshop Contributor. We cannot wait to see what else comes out of the Dota 2 Workshop community.

[url=http://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=133304836][img]http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/images/blogfiles/inline_treasure_of_the_shaper_divine.jpg[/img][/url]

In Tournament news, [url=http://www.dota2.com/store/itemdetails/101817554]The Defense 3[/url] Grand Finals are this weekend and if you happen to be one of the Immortal Highlanders that are still around since the start of the tournament then you are in for a treat! Virtus Pro faces Fnatic in a Best of Five that is sure to produce many memorable moments that should last until the next Defense ends or the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heat_death_of_the_universe]heat death of the universe[/url], whichever comes first.

Good news to you G-1 League fans! The fine fellows over [url=http://www.17173.com/]17173[/url] have added Inky the Hexapus courier to their [url=http://www.dota2.com/store/itemdetails/135034708]tournament pass[/url]. Early adopters should find Inky awaiting in their inventories when they log in -- make sure to bring a treat.

Finally, are you in Serbia? Do you like Dota 2? Do you have what it takes?! *insert guitar riff here* KGB-HQ is running a 32 team tournament at their cafe in Belgrade, Serbia. Interested? You can find more info [url=http://e-frag.net/v2/najavljen-dota-2-turnir-kgb-cm-storm-volume-2/]here[/url].

This [url=http://www.dota2.com/news/updates/]changelog [/url]fell off the back of Axe's van.

announcement_body.headline: No, no problems here
announcement_body.body:
Don't feed this guy.

[url=http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/images/blogfiles/keyart_troll.jpg ][img]http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/images/blogfiles/inline_hero_troll.jpg[/img][/url]

In happier news, our new Calendar system is now available. Leagues can add events to the calendar making pro games easier to follow than ever before.

[url=http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/posts/calendar_full.png][img]http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/posts/calendar.png[/img][/url]

 

And what better way of using this new feature than by following the new [url=http://www.dota2.com/store/itemdetails/120653104]SEA League[/url]? That GoDz guy is so dreamy.

 

We've also added All Random mode and tweaked Least Played to now hide a player's top 40 heroes.

And unlike last week, I will properly link to the [url=http://www.dota2.com/news/updates/]changelog [/url]this time.

announcement_body.headline: Polycount Contest Winners – Day 1
announcement_body.body:
The Dota 2 Polycount Contest began on October 8th and officially ended this past Monday December 3rd. Over that two month period the [url=http://www.polycount.com/]Polycount[/url] modeling community submitted more than 1,000 entries to the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/browse/?appid=570]Dota 2 Workshop[/url]. We aren’t exaggerating when we say that the sheer magnitude of high quality submissions has blown us away and that judging entries has been difficult because so many sets could have been winners. 

[url=http://blog.dota2.com/2012/12/polycount-contest/]Head over to the official Dota 2 blog to read up on the winners![/url]

announcement_body.headline: A Cornea-copia of Wards
announcement_body.body:
As all you pro Dota 2 players out there know, the most important skill to develop is map awareness. Now there's no easier way to look cool while winning games thanks to your new found skill than by checking out these freshly made [url=http://dota2.com/store/#cat=1]Wards[/url].

Also to be found in today's update is the option to start games in Reverse Captain's Mode when creating a practice lobby. In this mode Captain's pick the heroes they want the other team to play, resulting in either hilarious or painful games. And what better way to show off this new mode than by checking out the [url=http://dota2.com/store/itemdetails/96472158]atoD 2 tournamen[/url]t? Watch Pro teams like Na'Vi, mTw and Zero play heroes that don't usually get a chance to shine.

Oh, perhaps you're looking for [url=http://www.dota2.com/news/updates/]this[/url]?

announcement_body.headline: Diretide
announcement_body.body:
Candy! Greevils! Treats! 50 foot tall tricksters! We are not responsible for any loss of sleep caused by nightmares now that the Diretide is here!

[url=http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/posts/diretide_full.jpg][img]http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/posts/diretide_small.jpg[/img][/url]

Not only will you be able to play a brand new game mode inside Dota 2 but you'll also find that the regular Dota 2 map suddenly got spookier! Check [url=http://www.dota2.com/diretide/]here[/url] for details.

This is our first seasonal event and as always we would love to hear what you [url=http://www.valvesoftware.com/email.php?recipient=Dota+2+Team]think[/url].

[url=http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/posts/diretide_full.jpg]Happy Haunting[/url]!

announcement_body.headline: Introducing the Dota Store
announcement_body.body:
Today we’re announcing that Dota 2 will be free to play, and contain an optional in-game store filled with community created content submitted to the Steam Workshop.

[url=http://blog.dota2.com/2012/06/introducing-the-dota-store/][img]http://cdn.steampowered.com/v/gfx/apps/570/extras/Workshop_Dota2Workshop2.jpg[/img][/url]

You can read the full blog post here: [url=http://blog.dota2.com/2012/06/introducing-the-dota-store/]Introducing the Dota Store[/url].
